The best moment to passage is just before organoids in the center of the BME drop start dying, characterized by shedding of debris or a darker appearance, or when organoids reach a diameter larger than 300 μm (further referred to as a ‘confluent well’).
units.rationale: This is a core procedural step in organoid derivation, describing initial tissue processing.

units.title: Single-cell passaging for clonal selection
units.text: If you want to generate clonal organoid cultures after transfection, we recommend using an organoid culture that allows passaging via single cells. Using single cells, as opposed to fragments, will increase the likelihood that the organoids growing out after selection (e.g., by puromycin) indeed originate from single cells and are, thus, clonal.
units.rationale: This is a critical procedural guideline for ensuring clonality after genetic manipulation.

units.title: Cryopreservation of organoid cultures
units.text: We recommend cryopreserving at least six cryovials for each newly established organoid culture at an early passage (< passage 5).
units.rationale: This is a key preservation protocol to ensure sample backup and reproducibility.

units.title: Lipofectamine 2000 transfection of organoids
units.text: Organoids are incubated with a Lipofectamine 2000-based transfection mix (A), electroporated (B) or incubated with high-titer lentivirus (C) and plated in BME.
units.rationale: This describes the exact method for genetic manipulation using Lipofectamine 2000, a central protocol step.

units.title: Electroporation settings for organoids
units.text: For organoid electroporation, set the NEPA21 electroporator to the following settings: Poring pulse: Voltage 200 V, Pulse length 5 ms, Pulse interval 50 ms, Number of pulses 2, Decay rate 10%, Polarity +; Transfer pulse: Voltage 20 V, Pulse length 50 ms, Pulse interval 50 ms, Number of pulses 5, Decay rate 40%, Polarity +/−.
units.rationale: This provides precise, actionable equipment settings for electroporation, essential for reproducibility.

units.title: Selection of genetically modified organoids
units.text: Genetically modified organoids can be selected by antibiotic addition if a resistant marker is present. For example, Nutlin-3a can select for cells over-expressing MDM2, and epidermal growth factor (EGF) can select for cells over-expressing KRAS. We recommend defining the optimal concentration per selection agent and organoid culture, which is often the lowest concentration that kills 100% of untreated organoids.
units.rationale: This gives a clear, actionable protocol for selecting genetically modified organoids using specific agents and criteria.

units.title: Tissue preparation for organoid derivation
units.text: Transfer each tissue sample (<3–4 cm3) into a separate 50-ml Falcon tube filled with D-BSA. Keep tissues on ice until starting the isolation. Register the new sample in the corresponding lab management system. (Optional) Generate labels for collecting pieces of tissue for different purposes (DNA, RNA, protein and/or histology). Collect the 50-ml Falcon tube containing the normal or tumor tissue and transfer the tissue to a 10-cm glass Petri dish by decanting the 50-ml Falcon tube. Take a microscopic picture of the tissue, including a ruler in the picture. Make a note of how the tissue looks (ie, size, fatty, vascularized, necrotic, etc) in the corresponding.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, imperative sequence of steps for initial tissue handling, critical for protocol reproducibility.

units.title: Organoid plating in BME and culture initiation
units.text: Resuspend the pellet in an appropriate amount of BME. As a guideline, 200 µl is sufficient for a pellet of ~50 µl. The amount of BME to add scales linearly with the pellet volume. Plate 100 µl of BME containing organoid fragments per well of a 12-well plate. Turn the plate upside down and leave in the biosafety cabinet for 5 min. Transfer the plate, upside down, into a 37 °C incubator and leave to solidify for 30 min. Add 750 µl of pre-warmed (RT to 37 °C) Type 1 or Type 2 medium to each well and transfer to an incubator at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: This is a complete, sequential protocol for plating organoids in BME and initiating culture, including critical timing and conditions.
